core_rules: There are three paid action types: Load, Save, and Document Processing. DOM manipulation and creating a document from scratch are free.
Feature plugins NEVER work alone. At least one File Processor plugin (that supports the page’s formats) is required to load/save.
Current model requires the Converter feature plugin for cross-format saves (e.g., DOCX→PDF) in addition to the source and target Processor plugins.
From-scratch → PDF: needs only PDF Processor (because there is no Load).
Load DOCX → Save PDF: requires Word Processor + PDF Processor + Converter.
.NET Framework-only limitations: Document Printer works only on .NET Framework; PDF loading requires .NET Framework 4.6.1+ or supported platforms as noted.
Format families: 'Word 2003 XML' and 'Word 2007 XML' are covered by Word Processor, not XML File Processor (despite .xml extension).
SVG editing is NOT supported by Aspose.Words; only saving a document to SVG is supported via SVG File Processor.
Image File Processor does not 'create images' standalone; it saves a document to raster/vector image formats.

plugins.name: Document Printer
plugins.requires: At least one matching File Processor for the input format; .NET Framework only
notes: Requires Word Processor for DOC/DOCX/RTF, ODT Processor for ODT, etc.
Available only in .NET Framework version of Aspose.Words.

plugins.name: Document Comparer
plugins.requires: At least one matching File Processor for load/save of compared docs
notes: Compares two documents and produces revisions in the primary document.

plugins.name: Document Converter
plugins.requires: Source and target File Processor plugins for involved formats
notes: Enables cross-format saving using other processor plugins.
Cannot function alone. For DOCX→PDF you need: Word Processor + PDF Processor + Converter.
